events.name: Singapore Science Festival: X-periment!
events.description: The three-day science carnival celebrates the latest developments and research in the field of science and technology. There will be interactive innovations and experiments by local researchers and performances by The Flight Brothers from the Franklin Institute in the USA.

events.name: Academic Talk by 2016 IEEE Past President, Professor Howard E. Michel
events.description:
Speaker: 2015 IEEE President and CEO, 2016 IEEE Past President, Professor Howard E. Michel  Title: Experience in U.S. Air Force and career enhancement to a university professor and to IEEE president  Abstract: President Michel will talk the IEEE, the world's largest technical professional organization advancing technology for humanity, and about his experience in the U.S. Air Force, as a pilot, an engineer, a technical manager, and a satellite launch director.  Then, how he pursued R&D activities there, how he continued his career in the university, and become a leader of the biggest academic society of the world.  His talk will be helpful to undergraduate and graduate students, young researchers and anyone who who deal with technologies and products related to his experience.  It will also be helpful to specialists who want to enhance their activities and careers using academic societies.  It will also be helpful to researchers who consider to develop their careers to universities.
Sponsor: IEEE Singapore Section
events.location: LT3, Block 2, Level 4, SUTD, 8 somapah road, Singapore 487372
events.group_name: Singapore University of Technology and Design

events.name: Future Fridays: Back(casting) to the Future
events.description:
Your past is the future! Bring an object that is important to you, your family or your country and we will help you to teleport it to 2116. 

For the rest of the evening, we will then attempt to use backcasting to bring the object back to you. 

Ahem. 

What we mean is: for the upcoming session of Future Fridays, we will explore how thinking about the future can be exploratry and fun. We will also be learning a technique, backcasting, that can be used for more immediate planning horizons. :)

If you are joining us for this session, please RSVP via the FB page. And bring your object!
events.location: Sustainable Living Lab (SL2), 111 Middle Rd, Unit 01-02, Singapore 188969
